result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon (Pointing) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay surcharge and applicable court costs and surcharges by 11-02-15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon (Pointing)

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Wayne Burrows

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
- signed and filed.
The defendant's request for release ion electronic monitoring is denied as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless, and frustrate the Court's specific sentencing intent.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows in custody.  Attorney Amy MacArdy and Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Statements heard as to sentencing. 
COURT ORDERS: Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 11.2.15, or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11.2.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows not in court, in custody.  Amy MacArdy and Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel makes record. Matter is passed until 1:30.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell appears telephonically, defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows not in court, in custody.  
Hanna Kolberg for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Case heard off the record; Branch 07 in jury trial.  Parties still in contest posture.  Case remains set for Jury trial on 8-03-15 at 9:30 a.m. before Branch 35.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows not in court, in custody.  
Hanna Kolberg for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Discovery issues in co-defendant case (15CF1320).  Case adjourned for Final pre-trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 07-27-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 7.8.15 and for jury trial on 8.3.15.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 07-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows not in court, in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's appearance is waived by the Court.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07, Judge McAdams.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell appeared by phone prior to case being called. Defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows in custody. Ronald Dague on behalf of Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for status conference. Co-defendant case requesting an adjourned preliminary hearing. Parties notified of new date. Case adjourned for status in PE.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Kenneth Wayne Burrows in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to BRANCH PE.  Status conference scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
